title: Provision GitHub Tokens (provider configuration)
description: Provider configuration for the "Provision GitHub Tokens" GitHub Action.

permissions.description: Settings that control the token permissions that consumers can receive.

rules.description: Rules that define the permissions that consumers can receive.

repositories.description: Rules that define the permissions that consumers can receive for repositories.

items.description: A rule that defines the permissions that consumers can receive for repositories.

resources.description: A list of patterns to match against resource repositories when applying the rule.

items.description: A pattern which matches a resource repository owner and name. If a pattern with no owner part is specified, the pattern will match repositories with the same owner as the repository where the provider configuration file is defined.

consumers.description: A list of patterns to match against consumer repositories when applying the rule.

items.description: A pattern which matches a consumer repository owner and name. If a pattern with no owner part is specified, the pattern will match repositories with the same owner as the repository where the provider configuration file is defined.

provision.description: Settings that control where tokens can be provisioned by requesting repositories.

rules.description: Rules that define where tokens can be provisioned by requesting repositories.

secrets.description: Rules that define which secrets can be provisioned, and what types of secrets can be provisioned, by requesting repositories.

items.description: A rule that defines which secrets can be provisioned, and what types of secrets can be provisioned, by requesting repositories.

secrets.description: A list of patterns to match against secret names when applying the rule.

items.description: A pattern which matches a secret name.

requesters.description: A list of patterns to match against requesting repositories when applying the rule.

items.description: A pattern which matches a requesting repository owner and name. If a pattern with no owner part is specified, the pattern will match repositories with the same owner as the repository where the provider configuration file is defined.

to.description: Which types of secrets to allow provisioning to by requesting repositories.

github.description: Which types of GitHub secrets to allow provisioning to by requesting repositories.

organization.description: Which types of secrets to allow provisioning to in the requesting repository's GitHub organization.

organizations.description: Which types of secrets to allow provisioning to in other GitHub organizations.

additionalProperties.description: Which types of secrets to allow provisioning to in the specified GitHub organization.

repository.description: Which types of secrets to allow provisioning to in the requesting repository.

repositories.description: Which types of secrets to allow provisioning to in other repositories.

additionalProperties.description: Which types of secrets to allow provisioning to in the specified repository.

actions.description: Whether to allow provisioning to GitHub Actions secrets.

codespaces.description: Whether to allow provisioning to GitHub Codespaces secrets.

dependabot.description: Whether to allow provisioning to Dependabot secrets.

actions.description: Whether to allow provisioning to GitHub Actions secrets.

codespaces.description: Whether to allow provisioning to GitHub Codespaces secrets.

dependabot.description: Whether to allow provisioning to Dependabot secrets.

environments.description: GitHub repository environments to allow provisioning to.

additionalProperties.description: Whether to allow provisioning to the specified GitHub repository environment.
